title: That the General Committee minutes of December 4, 2023 be approved.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CSAC24-001, dated January 8, 2024, of the Commissioner of Community Services as follows: That respecting the Art Gallery of Peterborough, Council direct staff to proceed as outlined in Closed Session Report CSAC24-001 dated January 8, 2024, of the Commissioner of Community Services.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CSAC24-001, dated January 8, 2024, of the Commissioner of Community Services as follows: That respecting the Art Gallery of Peterborough, Council direct staff to proceed as outlined in Closed Session Report CSAC24-001 dated January 8, 2024, of the Commissioner of Community Services. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report LSOCS24-001, dated January 8, 2024 of the City Solicitor as follows: That staff and the Mayor be authorized to proceed as outlined in Closed Session Report LSOCS24-001 dated January 8, 2024 of the City Solicitor respecting the Jurisdiction of Ontario’s Ombudsman.
That item Report CSSS24-001 - Funding for CMHA and the Mobile Crisis Intervention Team Program, be approved on Consent.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report PKED24-001, dated January 8, 2024, of the Board Chair and President & CEO of Peterborough & the Kawarthas Economic Development, as follows: That Report PKED24-001 and accompanying presentation providing the Peterborough & the Kawarthas Economic Development 2023 Q3 & Q4 Strategic Plan Activities Report be received for information.

That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report FCSIS24-001, dated January 8, 2024, of the Commissioner of Finance and Corporate Support Services, as follows: a) That the Next Generation 9-1-1 project budget (2024 Capital Budget Ref #19- 104)be increased by the $2,092,800 Year 2 Next Generation 9-1-1 provincial funding allotment resulting in a total budget of $5,490,500; b) That the Treasurer, in consultation with the Chief Administrative Officer, be authorized to use the non-standard procurement processes to ensure the Next Generation 9-1-1 project is expedited to enable maximum use of the Next Generation 9-1-1 funding prior to March 31, 2024, including the contracting authority to purchase all necessary items to meet Next Generation 9-1-1 requirements; and c) That the Treasurer be authorized to transfer up to $500,000 from the Capital Levy Reserve to expedite the Next Generation 9-1-1 project and that staff be directed to report back on any transfers in a subsequent report to Council.

Whereas further to the request made to Council on December 11, 2023, by Camila Duarte, Executive Director of the Innovation Cluster, that: a) That staff be directed to report back to Council on the feasibility of deferring the Innovation Cluster’s remaining loan, b) That the Innovation Cluster be asked to clearly identify the economic benefits to the community that would result if the City were to forgive the loan; and c) That the report be brought back to Council in the first quarter of 2024.

That staff report back to Council on the cost and service level implications related to garbage pick-up at various condominiums in the city and, The financial implications of removing the garbage service from the tax fees paid by condominiums.
That this meeting be adjourned at 8:02 p.m.
